name: VTD multiagent v1.1.0
description: Multi-agent configuration (Swarm-pattern) for ВТД ordering flow. Prompts are stored in external files so they can be iterated independently.

ENTRY.name: ENTRY
ENTRY.description: Greets the caller, captures / updates delivery date and address, confirms them aloud.

handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Invoke after both date and address are confirmed (whether at the very beginning or after a requested change).

INTENT_CLASSIFIER.name: INTENT_CLASSIFIER
INTENT_CLASSIFIER.description: Routes the conversation by analysing the caller’s last utterance; afterwards says a neutral helper phrase.

handoffs.PRODUCT_SELECTOR: Use when the caller wants to add a product, search the catalogue, or continue choosing goods.
handoffs.CONFIRM_PRODUCT_FROM_CART: Use when the caller wants to remove or change an item already present in the cart.
handoffs.ENTRY: Use when the caller wants to change delivery date or address.
handoffs.CONFIRMATION_STAGE: Use when the caller asks what is already in the order or signals they may be ready to finish.
handoffs.GOODBYE: Use when the caller explicitly ends the conversation after final confirmation.

CONFIRM_PRODUCT_FROM_CART.name: CONFIRM_PRODUCT_FROM_CART
CONFIRM_PRODUCT_FROM_CART.description: Finds the exact SKU(s) the caller refers to (for removal / change); clarifies if ambiguous.

handoffs.REMOVE_FROM_CART: Use once a single SKU has been unambiguously identified and confirmed for removal.
handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use if no matching SKU is found or the caller aborts the removal request.

REMOVE_FROM_CART.name: REMOVE_FROM_CART
REMOVE_FROM_CART.description: Removes the specified SKU from the cart and confirms the action aloud.

handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use after the removal is completed or cancelled.

PRODUCT_SELECTOR.name: PRODUCT_SELECTOR
PRODUCT_SELECTOR.description: Suggests items from the caller’s last-month purchase history; if none fit, passes control to live catalogue search.

handoffs.SELECT_PACKAGING_AND_QUANTITY: Use when the caller chooses a suggested SKU from purchase history.
handoffs.SEARCH_RAG: Use when nothing suitable is found in purchase history or caller rejects suggestions.
handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use if the caller aborts adding a product or changes their mind.

SEARCH_RAG.name: SEARCH_RAG
SEARCH_RAG.description: Queries the live catalogue via rag_find_products; handles clarifying loops, tells when item is unavailable.

handoffs.SELECT_PACKAGING_AND_QUANTITY: Use once the caller picks a SKU from the search results.
handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use when the product cannot be found or the caller stops searching.

SELECT_PACKAGING_AND_QUANTITY.name: SELECT_PACKAGING_AND_QUANTITY
SELECT_PACKAGING_AND_QUANTITY.description: Lists available pack sizes for chosen SKUs, captures packaging selection, then captures quantity for each product sequentially.

handoffs.ADD_TO_CART_STAGE: Use after packaging and quantity are confirmed for all products.
handoffs.PRODUCT_SELECTOR: Use if the caller wants to select different products.
handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use when the caller cancels the operation.

ADD_TO_CART_STAGE.name: ADD_TO_CART_STAGE
ADD_TO_CART_STAGE.description: Repeats SKU-pack-quantity, asks final yes/no, calls add_to_cart upon ‘yes’, confirms aloud.

handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use after successfully adding (or cancelling) a product.

CONFIRMATION_STAGE.name: CONFIRMATION_STAGE
CONFIRMATION_STAGE.description: Reads out the actual cart, delivery date and address; asks if everything is correct or needs changes.

handoffs.GOODBYE: Use when the caller confirms everything is correct and is ready to finish.
handoffs.INTENT_CLASSIFIER: Use when the caller wants to add/remove items or change schedule/location.
handoffs.ENTRY: Use when the caller wants to change delivery date or address from this stage.

GOODBYE.name: GOODBYE
GOODBYE.description: Thanks the caller and terminates the call.

client.name: Customer
client.description: Customer calling to place an order

evaluator.name: Conversation Evaluator
evaluator.description: Expert evaluator of conversation quality with multi-agent support
